title: Footballer, 25, collapses and dies suddenly while getting ready for a friend's stag do after celebrating his birthday
text:
News Footballer, 25, collapses and dies suddenly while getting ready for a friend's stag do after celebrating his birthday Carl Shenton was found on the floor by his devastated mum Pam ahead of a pal's pre-wedding trip Share Carl Shenton collapsed while getting ready for a friend's stag trip (Photo: Facebook) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A fit and healthy 25-year-old footballer suddenly died as he as getting ready to go on a pal's stag do. 
Carl Shenton celebrated his birthday with friends the night before rising early to set off for a pre-wedding trip to Dublin. 
But minutes after mum Pam woke the keen footballer so he could catch an early coach to the gathering, she discovered him collapsed on the floor at the family home in Kidsgrove, Staffordshire. 
Devastated Pam, 58, said they were anxiously waiting for answers over what had caused the death of Carl - who enjoyed his job and was looking forward to a holiday with friends in Las Vegas. 
She told the Stoke Sentinel : "He always appeared so healthy, we just don't know why it happened. He was just a normal 25-year-old lad. Popular Carl pictured on a trip to Manchester United's Old Trafford stadium (Photo: Facebook) Read More Agony of teenage mum after her 'bubbly and mischievous' 19-month-old toddler dies suddenly in his sleep 
"Not knowing anything is very hard. We just want some answers." 
After the mystery collapse, Carl was rushed to hospital but medics were unable to save him and he died on February 1. 
Pam and Carl's father Chris followed their son's wish to donate his organs , which have already gone to help three seriously ill patients. 
They are now anxiously waiting for test results that they hope will reveal what caused Carl's death. The keen footballer was described as fit and healthy by his shocked family (Photo: Facebook) Read More 
Pam said: "He had been out with his mates in Kidsgrove the night before because it was his birthday. 
"He came home at midnight and was fine. 
"I had to get him up at 4am to get the coach and he was normal. 
"I could hear him walking around getting ready. I heard him make a noise, and when I went up he was just collapsed on the floor." 
A neighbour performed CPR on Carl, who worked for a chemicals firm in Leek, Staffordshire, before he was taken to Royal Stoke University Hospital. 
Doctors told his parents and 22-year-old sister Laura that nothing could be done to save him. Active Carl, pictured dog walking, had celebrated turning 25 with friends the evening before he collapsed (Photo: Facebook) 
Chris, 65, said: "We decided to donate his organs. He was on the organ donor register. 
"He had thought about it and made the decision, and he had made it clear to me that I must not countermand his wishes. 
"We believe he has saved three people â€“ his liver, pancreas and kidneys were donated. A bit of good has come out of adversity. It's the only thing that has made any sense out of all this." 
Carl had no history of medical problems apart from a recent bout tonsillitis, for which he was prescribed antibiotics. 
Pam said: "He had a lot to look forward to. He loved his job and had just started a junior management course, and he had got himself a new car which he thought was the bee's knees. 
"He was going to Las Vegas on holiday with his mates. He was very sociable and he was happy." 
Chris added: "He was very strong-minded. He had a crafty sense of humour, but he didn't do it with any malice. We have nobody or nothing to blame for his death. We are just in shock." 
Carl's funeral will be held at Bradwell Crematorium in Newcastle-under-Lyme on Wednesday. 
Donations will go to the Critical Care Unit at the Royal Stoke University Hospital. Like us on Facebook
